## load data

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, include=FALSE}

#query the corridors from bike_lanes
```

# distributional analysis
```{r, fig.asp=1, fig.width=9.5}
stark_dist <- portland_corridor %>% as.data.frame() %>% filter(Group == 1) %>% 
  group_by(Type, year) %>% 
  summarise(
    low_income = sum(CE01), mid_income = sum(CE02), high_income = sum(CE03), white = sum(CR01), black = sum(CR02),
    asian = sum(CR04), female = sum(CS02), bach = sum(CD04), col = sum(CD03), high_sch = sum(CD02), 
    tot_emp = sum(C000)) %>% 
  mutate(
    low_inc_perc = low_income/tot_emp*100,
    white_perc = white/tot_emp*100,
    black_perc = black/tot_emp*100,
    asian_perc = asian/tot_emp*100,
    female_perc = female/tot_emp*100,
    bach_col_perc = (bach+col)/tot_emp*100) 

pdx_dist <- portland_lehd %>% 
  group_by(year) %>% 
  summarise(
    low_income = sum(CE01), mid_income = sum(CE02), high_income = sum(CE03), white = sum(CR01),black = sum(CR02),
    asian = sum(CR04), female = sum(CS02), bach = sum(CD04), col = sum(CD03), high_sch = sum(CD02), 
    tot_emp = sum(C000)) %>% 
  mutate(
    low_inc_perc = low_income/tot_emp*100,
    white_perc = white/tot_emp*100,
    black_perc = black/tot_emp*100,
    asian_perc = asian/tot_emp*100,
    female_perc = female/tot_emp*100,
    bach_col_perc = (bach+col)/tot_emp*100,
    Type = "City") %>% 
  select(Type, year:bach_col_perc)

stark_dist <- rbind(as.data.frame(stark_dist), as.data.frame(pdx_dist))
stark_dist[stark_dist == 0] <- NA
stark_dist$Type <- as.factor(as.character(stark_dist$Type))
  
inc_plot <- dist_trend_plot(stark_dist,demo = "Low Income", demo_code = "low_inc_perc", corridor_name = "Stark & Oak Avenue", construct_year = 2009, end_year = 2010, 0, 30)

white_plot <- dist_trend_plot(stark_dist,demo = "White", demo_code = "white_perc", corridor_name = "Stark & Oak Avenue", construct_year = 2009, end_year = 2010, 84, 90)

black_plot <- dist_trend_plot(stark_dist,demo = "Black", demo_code = "black_perc", corridor_name = "Stark & Oak Avenue", construct_year = 2009, end_year = 2010, 2, 6)

asian_plot <- dist_trend_plot(stark_dist,demo = "Asian", demo_code = "asian_perc", corridor_name = "Stark & Oak Avenue", construct_year = 2009, end_year = 2010, 3, 7)

female_plot <- dist_trend_plot(stark_dist,demo = "Female", demo_code = "female_perc", corridor_name = "Stark & Oak Avenue", construct_year = 2009, end_year = 2010, 40, 60)

edu_plot <- dist_trend_plot(stark_dist,demo = "College Above Educated", demo_code = "bach_col_perc", corridor_name = "Stark & Oak Avenue", construct_year = 2009, end_year = 2010, 40,60)

plot_grid(inc_plot, female_plot, white_plot, black_plot, asian_plot, edu_plot,nrow = 3)

```


# additional distributional analysis - income (bar graph)
```{r echo=FALSE, fig.asp=0.5, fig.width=9.5, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
stark_inc <- portland_corridor %>% as.data.frame() %>% filter(Group == 1) %>% 
  mutate(Type = factor(Type, levels = c("Treatment", "Control: Alder", "Control: Everett"))) %>% 
  group_by(Type, year) %>% 
  summarise(low_income = sum(CE01), 
            mid_income = sum(CE02), 
            high_income = sum(CE03)) %>% 
  group_by(Type) %>% 
  gather(income_level, employment,low_income, mid_income, high_income) %>% 
  mutate(year = as.Date(as.character(paste0(year, "-01-01")),"%Y-%m-%d"),
         income_level = factor(income_level, levels=c("high_income", "mid_income", "low_income")),
         n = case_when(Type == "Treatment" ~ 38,
                       Type == "Control: Everett" ~30,
                       Type == "Control: Alder" ~ 25)) 

ggplot(data=stark_inc, aes(x=year, y=employment/n)) +
  geom_bar(aes(fill=income_level),stat = "identity")+
  facet_wrap(~Type)+
  scale_x_date(date_breaks = "3 years", date_labels = "%Y") +
  labs(title="Income Composition Trend Among Corridors", x="Year", y ="Employment per block", 
       caption = "Bike lane is constructed in 2009") +
  theme(legend.position = "bottom") +
  scale_fill_discrete(name="Income Level",
                      breaks=c("high_income", "mid_income", "low_income"),
                      labels=c("High income", "Middle income", "Low income"))
  

```


# additional distributional analysis - race (line chart)
```{r echo=FALSE, fig.asp=1.5, fig.width=9.5, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
stark_race <- portland_corridor %>% as.data.frame() %>% filter(Group == 1) %>% 
  group_by(Type, year) %>% 
  summarise(
    white = sum(CR01), black = sum(CR02), ameindian = sum(CR03), asian = sum(CR04), 
    hawaii=sum(CR05), other=sum(CR07), tot_emp = sum(C000)) %>% 
  mutate(white_perc = white/tot_emp*100,
         black_perc = black/tot_emp*100,
         ameindian_perc = ameindian/tot_emp*100,
         asian_perc = asian/tot_emp*100,
         hawaii_perc = hawaii/tot_emp*100,
         other_perc = other/tot_emp*100) 

pdx_race <- portland_lehd %>% 
  group_by(year) %>% 
  summarise(
    white = sum(CR01), black = sum(CR02), ameindian = sum(CR03), asian = sum(CR04), 
    hawaii=sum(CR05), other=sum(CR07), tot_emp = sum(C000)) %>% 
  mutate(white_perc = white/tot_emp*100,
         black_perc = black/tot_emp*100,
         ameindian_perc = ameindian/tot_emp*100,
         asian_perc = asian/tot_emp*100,
         hawaii_perc = hawaii/tot_emp*100,
         other_perc = other/tot_emp*100,
         Type = "City") %>% 
  select(Type, year:other_perc)


stark_race <- rbind(as.data.frame(stark_race), as.data.frame(pdx_race))
stark_race[stark_race$year<2009,][,c(3:8,10:15)] <- NA
stark_race$Type <- as.factor(as.character(stark_race$Type))
  

white_plot <- dist_trend_plot(stark_race,demo = "White", demo_code = "white_perc", corridor_name = "Stark & Oak Avenue", construct_year = 2009, end_year = 2010, 86, 90)

black_plot <- dist_trend_plot(stark_race,demo = "Black", demo_code = "black_perc", corridor_name = "Stark & Oak Avenue", construct_year = 2009, end_year = 2010, 1,5)

ameindian_plot <- dist_trend_plot(stark_race,demo = "American Indian", demo_code = "ameindian_perc", corridor_name = "Stark & Oak Avenue", construct_year = 2009, end_year = 2010, 0,4)

asian_plot <- dist_trend_plot(stark_race,demo = "Asian", demo_code = "asian_perc", corridor_name = "Stark & Oak Avenue", construct_year = 2009, end_year = 2010,3,7)

hawaii_plot <- dist_trend_plot(stark_race,demo = "Native Hawaiian", demo_code = "hawaii_perc", corridor_name = "Stark & Oak Avenue", construct_year = 2009, end_year = 2010,0,4)

other_plot <- dist_trend_plot(stark_race,demo = "Two or More Races", demo_code = "other_perc", corridor_name = "Stark & Oak Avenue", construct_year = 2009, end_year = 2010,0,4)

g_legend<-function(a.gplot){
  tmp <- ggplot_gtable(ggplot_build(a.gplot))
  leg <- which(sapply(tmp$grobs, function(x) x$name) == "guide-box")
  legend <- tmp$grobs[[leg]]
  return(legend)}

mylegend<-g_legend(white_plot)

grid.arrange(arrangeGrob(white_plot + theme(legend.position="none"), black_plot + theme(legend.position="none"),
                         asian_plot + theme(legend.position="none"), ameindian_plot + theme(legend.position="none"),
                         hawaii_plot + theme(legend.position="none"), other_plot + theme(legend.position="none"),
                         nrow=3),
             mylegend, nrow=4,heights=c(10, 1,1,1))
```


# additional distributional analysis - race (table)
```{r}
start_end_race <- stark_race %>%
  select(Type, year, ends_with("_perc")) %>% # select variables ends with "_perc"
  filter(complete.cases(.)) %>%
  group_by(Type) %>% 
  summarise_at(vars(ends_with("_perc")), funs(change = (last(.)-first(.))/first(.)/6*100))

  (is.numeric, funs(change = (last(.)-first(.))/first(.)))
  
  
# calculate year by year race categories percentage change  
y_o_y_race <- stark_race %>% 
  select(Type, year, ends_with("_perc")) %>% 
  mutate_if(is.numeric, funs(change = ./lag(.)*100 -100)) %>% 
  group_by(Type) %>% 
  summarise_at(vars(ends_with("_change")), funs(mean(., na.rm=T)))

```
